title: Fragment With Chef De Piece, 1790–99
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: block-printed on plain weave. Blocks for two reds, black, yellow, blue and grey. Irregular outline of yellow block visible as are registration marks for darker red block.
inscribed: Stamps at one end of piece; On front: "J.CHEVALLIE" within box in yellow (twice) and blue flower. On back: "MANUFACTURE DE TOILES PEINTES & MOUCHOIRS DE LEMASURIER.BAYON & COMP. A. ANGERS.BON.TEINT" in black in elongated oval. There is a small medallion in the center of this stamp "N./D 98". The mark is indistinct and the 98 looks as if it has been put in by hand. There is also indication that a stamp in grey was formerly on this fabric. Only one edge of that stamp remains.
provenance: Formerly in the collection of Elinor Merrell where it was No. 35 on her list of chefs de piece.
dimensions: Warp: 36 cm (14 1/4 in.). Weft: 99 cm (39 in.) Both selvedges present. Pattern: Not present.
description: Scalloped edge piece with design of swans in water, plants and trees alternate with stripes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment With Chef De Piece, 1790–99.
1790–99. Medium: cotton
Technique: block-printed on plain weave. Blocks for two reds, black, yellow, blue and grey. Irregular outline of yellow block visible as are registration marks for darker red block.. Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-26.
